FindDerivationProblem.Grammar: S -> a S b | a | S S
S -> S a T | T T -> T b F | F F -> x S x | y

WordsInGrammarProblem.Grammar: S -> E c E -> E a T | T T -> T b c | c
S -> T a T -> T a T b | _

FindDerivationProblem.Grammar: S -> A a A -> A a B | B b B -> B b a | a

problem.name: f17
problem.description: words that have an odd number of a

DescriptionToGrammarProblem.Grammar: S -> A E B -> b B | _ A -> B a B E -> A A E | _

WordsInGrammarProblem.Grammar: S -> a S b | b S a | _

problem.name: f16
problem.description: words that are the concatenation of two words of odd length with the same middle symbol (e.g., abbaabab, as this is the concatenation of abb and aabab, two words with b as middle letter).

DescriptionToGrammarProblem.Grammar: S -> U U | V V U -> X U X | a V -> X V X | b X -> a | b

problem.name: f18
problem.description: words that can be written w z w^R with w nonempty, that is, they start with a word, and end with its reverse.

DescriptionToGrammarProblem.Grammar: S -> a S a | b S b | a X a | b X b X -> a X | b X | _

problem.name: f9
problem.description: words that start and end with the same letter.

problem.name: f7
problem.description: words that have "bab" at some point, and then "aab" later on.

problem.name: f8
problem.description: words that have a number of b that is a multiple of three.

problem.name: f6
problem.description: words that have baabb as subword

problem.description: words that start and end with the same letter.

problem.name: 0odd,1even
problem.description: {w| w starts with 0 and has odd length, or starts with 1 and has even length}

{1}^* ({001} {1}^*)^*, that is the language of words that start with any number of 1s, followed by any repetition of a word of the form: 001 followed by any number of 1s.
Three states are enough!

problem.name: a

problem.name: leq5
problem.description: {w| the length of w is at most 5} Hint: \e is the empty word.

problem.name: ll0u

problem.name: moretwo0lessone1
problem.description:
{w| w contains at least two 0s and at most one 1}
Think about where the 1 could be.

problem.name: not (ab+)*
problem.description: {w| w is any word which is not a repetition of strings of the form (ab)(b...b) }. Note that "repetition" and "..." may indicate zero such things.

DFAConstructionProblem.Automaton: <automaton> <automatonType>false</automatonType> <deterministic>true</deterministic> <epsilon>false</epsilon> <alphabet> <symbol>a</symbol> <symbol>b</symbol> </alphabet> <block posY='0' posX='0' final='false' regex='' sid='0'><stateSet><state posY='236.8941032056576' posX='118.88008174641915' final='false' initial='true' sid='1'/><state posY='244.6875' posX='459.5' final='false' initial='false' sid='3'/><state posY='240.94869983939964' posX='291.7622303812802' final='true' initial='false' sid='5'/><state posY='118.3125' posX='214.5' final='true' initial='false' sid='6'/></stateSet><transitionSet><transition tid='0'><from>3</from><to>3</to><label>b</label></transition><transition tid='1'><from>1</from><to>5</to><label>a</label></transition><transition tid='2'><from>5</from><to>3</to><label>b</label></transition><transition tid='3'><from>6</from><to>6</to><label>a b</label></transition><transition tid='4'><from>1</from><to>6</to><label>b</label></transition><transition tid='5'><from>5</from><to>6</to><label>a</label></transition><transition tid='6'><from>3</from><to>5</to><label>a</label></transition></transitionSet><acceptingSet><state sid='5'/><state sid='6'/></acceptingSet><initialState><state sid='1'/></initialState></block> </automaton>

problem.name: not 110
problem.description:
{w| w doesnï¿½t contain the substring 110}
Hint: It's useful to think about the DFA for that language (use the DFA for (0|1)*110(0|1)*, then swap the accept and nonaccept states).
What is the regexp for words that go from the initial back to the initial? Let's call this E. Once you're done looping from the initial state back to itself, you can go to the second or third state, but not the fourth. Call F the language of words that start from the initial state and go to the second or third state without going back to the initial state. Then your answer is EF.
(One possible regexp has 9 characters.)

problem.name: not a nor b
problem.description: {w| w is any string except a and b}

DFAConstructionProblem.Automaton: <automaton> <automatonType>false</automatonType> <deterministic>true</deterministic> <epsilon>false</epsilon> <alphabet> <symbol>a</symbol> <symbol>b</symbol> </alphabet> <block posY='0' posX='0' final='false' regex='' sid='0'><stateSet><state posY='240' posX='123.33333333333333' final='true' initial='true' sid='1'/><state posY='182.6875' posX='225.5' final='false' initial='undefined' sid='2'/><state posY='338.6875' posX='226.5' final='false' initial='undefined' sid='3'/><state posY='262.6875' posX='341.5' final='true' initial='undefined' sid='4'/></stateSet><transitionSet><transition tid='0'><from>4</from><to>4</to><label>a b</label></transition><transition tid='1'><from>1</from><to>2</to><label>a</label></transition><transition tid='2'><from>1</from><to>3</to><label>b</label></transition><transition tid='3'><from>3</from><to>4</to><label>a b</label></transition><transition tid='4'><from>2</from><to>4</to><label>a b</label></transition></transitionSet><acceptingSet><state sid='1'/><state sid='4'/></acceptingSet><initialState><state sid='1'/></initialState></block> </automaton>

problem.name: not a* U b*
problem.description: {w | w is not a string in {a}* U {b}*}

problem.name: not a*b*
problem.description: {w | w is any string not of the form a...ab...b }; note that the number of a's and b's can be zero. In other words, the string is not in {a}*{b}*.

DFAConstructionProblem.Automaton: <automaton> <automatonType>false</automatonType> <deterministic>true</deterministic> <epsilon>false</epsilon> <alphabet> <symbol>a</symbol> <symbol>b</symbol> </alphabet> <block posY='0' posX='0' final='false' regex='' sid='0'><stateSet><state posY='254' posX='123.33333333333333' final='false' initial='true' sid='1'/><state posY='259.6875' posX='253.5' final='false' initial='undefined' sid='2'/><state posY='262.6875' posX='444.5' final='true' initial='undefined' sid='3'/></stateSet><transitionSet><transition tid='0'><from>1</from><to>1</to><label>a</label></transition><transition tid='1'><from>2</from><to>2</to><label>b</label></transition><transition tid='2'><from>1</from><to>2</to><label>b</label></transition><transition tid='3'><from>3</from><to>3</to><label>a b</label></transition><transition tid='4'><from>2</from><to>3</to><label>a</label></transition></transitionSet><acceptingSet><state sid='3'/></acceptingSet><initialState><state sid='1'/></initialState></block> </automaton>

problem.description: {w | w is any string except 11 and 111}

problem.name: not11nor111
problem.description:
{w| w is any string except 11 and 111}
Hints: Regexps are not great for that. It's any string of length more than 4, plus some strings of length 3 and less.

problem.name: noteps
problem.description: All strings except the empty string

problem.name: odd1
problem.description: {w| every odd position of w is a 1}

problem.name: oddpos=1
problem.description: {w | every odd position of w is a 1}

problem.name: pal
problem.description: {w| w = w^R , that is, w is a palindrome} over {a, b}

DescriptionToGrammarProblem.Grammar: S -> a S a | b S b | a | b | _

problem.name: sigasigbsigasig
problem.description: sigasigbsigasig

FindDerivationProblem.Grammar: S -> X S X | R R -> a T b | b T a T -> X T X | X | _ X -> a | b

problem.name: stuab
problem.description: stuab

WordsInGrammarProblem.Grammar: S -> T T | U T -> a T | T a | b U -> a U aa | b

problem.name: u1v1x1y
problem.description: {w| w contains at least three 1s}

problem.name: wodd
problem.description: {w| the length of w is odd} over {a, b}

DescriptionToGrammarProblem.Grammar: S -> L | L L S L -> a | b

problem.name: x0101y
problem.description: {w| w contains the substring 0101 (i.e., w = x0101y for some x and y)}
